comment: I took him over summer and with nearly a 3 hour class I genuinely couldn't listen to every lecture. Very passionate guy who has a good amount of practice exams for tests and good homework but that's about the only way you're going to learn anything. Does offer online classes (as of Summer 2025) which I would highly recommend

He's a cool and funny dude but he does not know how to properly teach. The majority of the class time is spent on his tangents that are usually not even related to EE. His D2L page has assignments that date back to 2015 and lots of confusing instructions that he seems to have never updated. Not bad but I would look elsewhere.

This professor is a mess, babbles on about things that are not even relevent to the course, is constantly moving due dates, and contradicts assignment instructions that are posted on D2L. It is clear this professor isn't even clear in his own mind what the requirements are for any of the assignments posted. Be graded on out dated information.

Simple assignments were hellish to complete with a lack of instructions. Almost no one ever knows what's going on. Crimm is nice and can be lenient w deadlines, but does not teach at all, instead discussing other unrelated topics. Not recommended, but if you must, befriend classmates or make a Groupme. DON'T TAKE for upper level classes.

He obviously tries to be entertaining when teaching, and I admire that quality, but he simply can't communicate the course material effectively for students, or at least not for me. D2L is a mess, which leads to unnecessary stress, and assignments are too vague to understand what you need to do. I wouldn't recommend taking this if you can avoid it.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!!! He's a cool guy and all but you will not learn a single thing in or outside of his class. You can pass doing somewhat nothing in his class but you will feel drowned in information that you won't be able to understand due to his lack of communicative ability, resources, and conflicting information.

Crimm is clearly knowledgeable and loves what he "teaches", but can not teach. Labs are way harder than necessary, with some being literal final projects for other 2501 courses. Tests have annoyingly silly questions with upwards of 20 answer choices. D2L is unorganized and his office is a wreck. Seemed annoyed when asking questions. Avoid taking.

Digital Logic, 1 Midterm, 1 Final, & quizzes. Reuses old exams and pull directly from the quizzes. The TA is super helpful and has VHDL tutorial videos. The labs are challenging especially the traffic light final proj. Exams are open notes. You learn Binary, boolean alg, logic gates, BCD, Encoder, Hazards, Flipflops, Counters, RAM/ROM, K-Map etc!

ENGR Ethics. Class is only once per week, he has an online option & group teams. His assignments are easy to do. Introduction discussion, professional organization groups, Solving Ethical Dilemmas, and FE review. He has sample midterms and finals. Example Question: How do Professional organizations define and establish ethical understandings?
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: EE1000 (OLD) . Take Crimm for 1000. Teaches you fundamental Voltage, Current, Resistance. You get to solder a power supply for lab, write formal/informal lab reports. Convinces you why EE is greater than other Engineering disciplines. You learn to write a resume, do a research project, and learn about Mandelbrot Fractals. This is a relaxed class.

Circuit Analysis 2. Great professor!, always comes to class with a list of topics, has a binder of organized notes, online option, multiple attempts for quizzes and exams. He reviews Sinusoidal Steady-State and AC Circuits which is helpful when you forget Circuit 1. He next begins with polyphase, transformers, Laplace, resonance, and Fourier.

Passionate, knowledgeable, funny professor who absolutely cannot teach. 60% of lecture is chaotic rambling about whatever is on his mind, rest is disorganized examples without diving into the "why". D2L is completely unorganized and has content posted from the past few years making it impossible to find anything or calculate your grade.

Most scatterbrained professor at this school. Lectures are chaotic and his quizzes are complete nonsense. He also is incapable of answering a question that is not a yes or no question. Only positive thing is his TA. He is incredibly knowledgeable and can actually explain the nonsensical lab instructions. The TA is the only reason I know anything.

Nice guy, very passionate, but completely incompetent at teaching. Rambles endlessly in class and doesn't teach any material. Assigns excessive amounts of work. Disorganized and catastrophic D2L - good luck sorting through it all. Homework is heavy and the answer keys are wrong without explanation. Avoid him for upper level classes at ALL costs.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Crimm's class was not overly hard. A lot of the content on the exams is NOT from his lectures. Heavily study the past exams and you should be good. He does give retakes and averages scores. I did not learn much from his class

This professor is entertaining but does a very poor job of actually teaching. Lectures are intensely disorganized. He frequently "remembers" teaching things to the class but he's actually referring to a previous year. D2L is a mess because he uploads documents at random and doesn't clean it out between semesters. Take any other EE professor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: As other's have said, he is a very funny teacher. However being funny does not make one a good teacher. He went off topic constantly and I'd reckon that a very tiny portion of his lectures were actually relevant to what we were learning. Great guy, very nice and caring. But extremely scatterbrained. I wouldn't recommend him for higher level courses

Don't expect to learn anything or even cover any course content during the class.  During the class time he will just choose something and go on to rant about for an hour without ever mentioning the course material.  On the tests half the questions don't relate to the material, but are just "test your tech skill and find ..." on google.

Dont take him for anything other than Ee1000. He doesnt teach. His lectures are just him rambling about whatevers on his mind and then he wonders why we are struggling. He doesnt work out examples. He doesnt grade any work. Its chaos.

Kinda wild and funny guy great for ee intro especially if you want to know if its the major for you. He is usually early or does not show up . He cares for his students for sure if you ask a question he will actually talk to you does cool experiments and etc it doesnt even feel like a class more what you actually want advising to be.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Just pay attention to when stuff is due and you will pass. Some group work that is really easy and gives practice exams that are EXACTLY like the test. Honestly, don't even worry about this class. I guess in this case it can be said Skip class? You will actually pass
He is a pretty chill, funny guy. But I don't think I really learned anything but its alright we are just here to go w the flow.

Had Crimm when he was "tag-teaming" the teaching because Chakravarty couldn't come for the Thursday afternoon class. This was the most unorganized, convoluted, and worst class that I have ever had the displeasure of taking at Kennesaw. The 'optional' class presentation is now required (3 days before the due date) and worth 10% of your grade. :))
Lance Crimm is off the goop, truly. 10/10

I'm taking him right now for EE2501. Very genuine, cares about the class. Will extend deadlines when class seems like they're struggling. Prompt with email replies, and is a lenient grader. Class always struggles. Does not teach. Think of him a tutor and be more successful. Always off-topic in class. Unorganized. Graded topics not covered in class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: He was good for this simple EE1000 class; he made some of the quizzes we had much harder than they should be. Goofs off a lot (wRitnG lIke THs sOmeTImEs) in class, quizzes, emails, etc. Pretty interesting guy though. I wouldn't say he is a bad teacher, but I do not know how I would like him in an actual class setting as opposed to this gimme class

I thought he was funny, and I did actually learn a lot despite him being a bit of a joker for this 1 credit class. Attendance kind of matters, but not really? He does not show up sometimes either so this is why I am on the fence about attendance. He cares for his students for sure. I would take him for an easy A for EE1000.
Lance is the best. Nuff' said!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Crimm's classes are bizarre. His material is a mixture of the last week's review, a little new stuff, and whatever he happens to be thinking about that day. He goes off on funny tangents while trying really hard to tie it back in. He seems to like group projects, which almost never go well. Overall, he's easy; just sit back and enjoy the madness.

Crimm is an amazing professor who is there for his students. Have a question? Ask. You'll get an answer and then some. The tests are tough, but there for you to learn from them. Grading is fair, but bonus credit is given like crazy. If you attend lectures and pay attention, you'll be fine. Lectures are fun, interesting, and a little crazy.

Do NOT take him if you actually want to learn how to be effective in your field, you're more likely to learn about when he worked at Apple. Tests come out of left field and are a waste of time to take and study for. He cannot manage a classroom or himself, and hands out grades to compensate. Skips whole chapters and expects homework from them.
Don't take him for the orientation class.

I've taken Crimm for three courses: Professional Practice, Eng. Ethics and Intro to EE. All three of these courses are 'gimme' grades. Prof. Practice and Ethics are both online andor hybrid optional classonline. Crimm knows these courses are a waste of time and treats them accordingly. He's a good guy & if you participate you'll do well.

Gave answers to quizzes in class, gave extensions like crazy. Cares about students. Don't have to read textbook, I wouldn't even buy it. Soldering was my favorite part, but the lab was awful as we didn't go over it enough to understand the concepts. Overall, good professor for this course, but I'm not sure if I would take him for a higher level EE

I just graduated in EE and this is the BEST prof to take at SPSU! Be sure to take him at least once. I had him for 1000, 2501, 4701, and 4800. He helped me find a job and just goes out of his way for students. Crimm is super challenging but you really learn a ton and are prepared for the real world.

Don't know what that last guy was talking about. This prof is the best. we had plenty of time and he extends deadlines like crazy to finish the work. Crimm makes EE so interesting and fun even though it's so hard! really cares for his students

This guy is quite possibly the worst professor I have ever encountered. He teaches absolutely nothing. You'll spend most of class talking about his life story rather than preparing for his god awful quizzes. Oh and good luck navigating his d2l page. Also be ready for a last minute research paper that he assigns days before finals... So bad.
Fun Teacher. It was an introduction class, but assignments were kept to a minimum and we all (I think) passed easily. If you want to take SPSU 1001, take him, he's probably the best option available.

While the class itself is a 1-hour online class, Crimm did a great job at explaining everything. Vey cool and "real" guy. I catch him playing raquetball all of the time and he's always willing to talk. He also makes sure to only "sweat" the big stuff, something most professors can't seem to understand.
Keeps it interesting, I would take his class again. Just for the stories.

AMAZING TEACHER!  I had this prof for EE1000 and then also for Circuits. I plan to take Crimm for many more.  He keeps the learning fun and interesting.  These other guys have no idea how Crimm makes complex material so understandable.  The stories and illustrations he gives in class is so helpful in learning the material.

He is a very friendly guy, but not a good professor at all! He likes to make a very easy class extremely difficult. He is so hilarious, but doesn't teach. Don't take him if you REALLY care about your GPA.
Lance Crimm is an amazing professor, with a great amount of clarity. Be prepared for w difficult class tempered by a stunning mentor.

Be prepared for a difficult class if you've never taken any electrical classes. Pay attention in class when he teaches, do the hw, do the labs. Those are the easy grades. The tests are more difficult, but he sends out practice tests without answers  before each test. Fair grading scale, just show that you learned the material and tried hard.

he doesn't care about anyone,he doesn't know how to tech tech. All he does is talk about everything in the class except subject. If learning out of the book is your style u might like him but each section you have to read is about 30pgs long with like size 7 font. its impossible without a good teacher!!

had him for Circuits and other classes.  his class is the most challenging ever but it really prepared me for all the other EE classes.  now have him in senior project and he is just amazing.  he really cares about students and goes out of his way to help out.  you may find him more difficult than other profs but he is well worth it!  take Crimm!
Pretty easy class seeing how it was only orientation. He is very funny and certainly keeps you paying attention.

Dr. Crimm certainly knows circuits and does want a student centered class which is great.  However, the class often became unfocused and hard to follow.  Also it?s difficult to find him during his chosen office hours and that is very discouraging to students that want to learn, but need extra help.  Tests are a bit difficult, but he was willing to
This guy is hilarious and keeps the learning fun!  The work is so challenging, but he accomodates by extending deadlines as needed

Cool as a person, but not so cool as a teacher. It was probably because he did not care for this class because it was an orientation class. He is funny, but gets off topic very easily because of ADD or something. Easy A class though.
He is amazing and will keep your interest lively throughout the class time.  Not only is he super hot, but his energy and enthusiasm make an hour seem to go by so quick.  Best prof I've had yet!

Where were you during the Fundamentals labs???? I guess you shouldn't take any summer courses from Crimm. He is likable and a good teacher, but don't expect to learn how to hook up a switch board from him. Guess that's why he's teaching EE now.
Great professor but, you will learn the material in order to pass the class.  THE BEST professor that I have ever had.

If you can afford to get a B or a C take his class. You're gonna hate the fact the the other fundamental classes have test that are ridiculously easier than his but it helps. He will make every other class not with him a joke.
If you take him for D3, you'll be kicking and screaming.  In the end, you'll be able to write your own 8051 book.
thinks he knows all, he should just get to the point like  Dr. Omar Zia does.

took him for ecet 1000. Pay attention to little offers for an easy A in the beginning of the semester. Have a perfect attendance and  make B or better on every assignment and you have an guaranteed A. Classes are boring sometimes and useless but are helpful sometimes. If i had to grade him on his teaching ability i would give him b+.
He's a very funny man, great guy, but he does not know how to lecture. He spend whole class to tell you how his kids doing and explain the lab.. If you you can study by yourself you should be OK.
Expects a lot from the student, but is willing to help.  Tests are very difficult; however, he curves them.
He is sometimes hard to follow, but overall a good teacher. He likes to push his students and see them succeed. He is flexible with due daes and tests and is usually available for help.

I took him for ECET 1000 got an A, D2 got a B and D3 got an A.  You cant find him in lab if you need help.  He might be out having picknic with his family during lab time.  Hard, and very challenging.  You have to earn the great!
Good teacher, he wants to stay a kid forever and has some helpful hints for students. Funny guy definately enjoy his class
No Comments

I got an A in ECET1000 with him so i took ECET2210 with him right now and he is hard! But he will help u out at almost anytime, but he tend to not be in his office. The guy just run around and sometime hard to catch him. He like to challenge students.  I hope to get a B at least from his ECET2210.
If you want to learn, this is the professor to take.  Sure he's difficult, but he wants you to earn a good grade. In the end, its all worth it.

I had to drop this class because he never taught anything. All he does is talk about everything but the class. If learning out of the book is your style u might like him but each section you have to read is about 30pgs long with like size 7 font. its impossible without a good teacher!!

He is HARD!  You can learn from him, but you must pay attention, and strangely sometimes help him to focus in class.  He seems to enjoy seeing students squirm as he makes projects harder than they have to be, but he wants you to think.  Overall he is a good professor.  He will help oustide of class.

He is very smart, but not the most helpful, he likes to add stuff at the last minute to projects making hard ones even harder. His grading system either benifits you or it hurts you depending on if he remebers to check certain things.
He is okay but tends to add some "extra challenges" as he says to assignments, projects and class work. But i assure you, you will learn a lot.
No Comments
He is so cool.  If have this guy for any subject, you will learn.  Dont be afraid to ask him for help.  He love to help student out.
Really cool. Really smart. Teaches speedily, you may have to slow him down to understand the concepts you haven't been exposed to.
